title: Louis Walsh says he quit X Factor after Simon Cowell 'paid him off'
text:
Louis Walsh has revealed the real reason he quit the X Factor

(Picture: Getty)

Louis Walsh has admitted that he only left X Factor because fellow judge Simon Cowell ‘paid him off’.

The music manager left the hit ITV show in 2012 because he was handed a massive pay out by Simon Cowell – but he says he’s glad to be back.

Louis, who was part of the official judging line-up when the show first hit our screens in 2004, admitted to Daily Star Online his decision to walk away was simply due to him being ‘paid off’ rather than an epic row behind the scenes.

Chatting at the 2019 Specsavers Spectacle Wearer of the Year Awards ahead of the new series of Celebrity X Factor this weekend, Louis, 67, said: ‘I wasn’t kicked off.

‘In fact, I was paid off if you really want to know the truth.

‘I’m back, listen, you would take it if you were offered it… it was a lot.’

Louis left X Factor in 2012 after he admitted that Simon Cowell ‘paid him off’ (Picture: SYCO/THAMES TV)

The 67-year-old also insisted that there is no feud with pal Simon Cowell.

He added: ‘Never, ever, ever. I was there for so long – it’s fun.

‘The new celebrity show is amazing and we have some amazing people on it. Megan McKenna is amazing and even Martin Bashir… he will surprise you.’

Megan Mckenna is one of the contestants for this year’s Celebrity X Factor (Picture: SYCO/THAMES TV)

Hitting out at Westlife for recently saying they believed Louis’ X Factor axe was part of ‘a script’, Louis said: ‘They don’t know what they are talking about.’

On Saturday Louis will return to the small screen when X Factor Celebrity finally kicks off along with Simon Cowell and Nicole Scherzinger.

In a bid to breathe new life into the show, Simon has shaken things up by splashing out of 15 celebrity acts to battle it out for a recording contract.

This weekend the first of two Judges’ Houses episodes will air on ITV as the famous faces sing to impress the judges.

The Love Island band, who were put together by X Factor bosses, consists of Zara McDermott, Samira Mighty, Wes Nelson and Eyal Booker.

Other famous faces include Ricki Lake and Jenny ‘The Vixen’ Ryan from The Chase.
